org.codehaus.groovy.grails.plugins.jasper
[Groovy] Class JasperReportDef

java.lang.Object
  org.codehaus.groovy.grails.plugins.jasper.JasperReportDef
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
class JasperReportDef

An abstract representation of a Jasper report.

It contains the location of the report design file (name and folder) and data(reportData and/or parameters) needed to fill the report.

Authors:
Sebastian Hohns 2010

Property Detail

contentStream

java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream contentStream
The generated report as OutputStream.

fileFormat

JasperExportFormat fileFormat
The target file format.

folder

java.lang.String folder
The parent folder of the report file.

This can be an absolute path or an relative path based on class path.

jasperPrinter

net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JasperPrint jasperPrinter

locale

java.util.Locale locale
Locale setting.

name

java.lang.String name
The name of the report file without extension.

The file can be in jrxml- or jasper-format.

parameters

java.util.Map parameters
Additional parameters.

reportData

java.util.Collection reportData
The data source used to fill the report.

This is a list of java beans.

getApplicationContext

private java.lang.Object getApplicationContext()

getFilePath

java.lang.String getFilePath()
Return the file path. The filepath can be set per file (highest priority) or based on the jasper.dir.reports setting. Defaults to /report.
Returns:
full path to the report, without extension

getReport

org.springframework.core.io.Resource getReport()
Looks for the report file in the filesystem. The file extension can either be .jasper or .jrxml. if japser.compile.files is set to true the report will be compiled and stored in the same folder as the jrxml file.
throws:
Exception , report file not found
Returns:
the report as Resource

setFilePath

void setFilePath(java.lang.String path)
